intro: Lycianthes coriacea, commonly known as the rough huito, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by egg-shaped, green fruits. Its leaves are often covered in a rough, waxy texture, which gives it its common name. Lycianthes coriacea is typically found in dry, open habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
